section.heading: Definitions.

content.p: As used inNRS 240.001to240.206, inclusive, unless the context otherwise requires, the words and terms defined inNRS 240.002to240.0067, inclusive, have the meanings ascribed to them in those sections.

section.heading: ï¿½Acknowledgmentï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Acknowledgmentï¿½ means a declaration by a person that he or she has executed an instrument for the purposes stated therein and, if the instrument is executed in a representative capacity, that the person signed the instrument with proper authority and executed it as the act of the person or entity represented and identified therein.

section.heading: ï¿½Credible witnessï¿½ defined.

content.p: Swears or affirms that the signer of a document is the person whom he or she claims to be; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is known personally to the signer of the document and the notarial officer.

section.heading: ï¿½Domestic partnersï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Domestic partnersï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 122A.030.

section.heading: ï¿½In a representative capacityï¿½ defined.

content.p: For and on behalf of a corporation, partnership, trust or other entity, as an authorized officer, agent, partner, trustee or other representative; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As a public officer, personal representative, guardian or other representative, in the capacity recited in the instrument; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
In any other capacity as an authorized representative of another.

section.heading: ï¿½Juratï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Juratï¿½ means a declaration by a notarial officer that the signer of a document signed the document in the presence of the notarial officer and swore to or affirmed that the statements in the document are true.

section.heading: ï¿½Notarial actï¿½ defined.

content.p: Taking an acknowledgment; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Administering an oath or affirmation; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Certifying a copy; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Executing a jurat; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Noting a protest of a negotiable instrument; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Performing such other duties as may be prescribed by a specific statute.

section.heading: ï¿½Notarial officerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Notarial officerï¿½ means a notary public or an officer authorized to perform notarial acts.

section.heading: ï¿½Notarial recordï¿½ defined.

content.p: The journal that an electronic notary public is required to keep pursuant toNRS 240.201; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A document or other evidence retained by a notary public or an electronic notary public to record the performance of a notarial act or an electronic notarial act.

section.heading: ï¿½Notary publicï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Notary publicï¿½ means a person appointed to perform a notarial act by the Secretary of State pursuant toNRS 240.010.

section.heading: ï¿½Personï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Personï¿½ means a natural person.

section.heading: ï¿½Stateï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Stateï¿½ means a state of the United States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the United States Virgin Islands or any territory or insular possession subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.

section.heading: Information and documents filed with or obtained by Secretary of State: Public examination; confidentiality; disclosure.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in subsections 2 and 3, information and documents filed with or obtained by the Secretary of State pursuant toNRS 240.001to240.206, inclusive, are public information and are available for public examination. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Information and documents filed with or obtained by the Secretary of State pursuant to or in accordance with subsection 3 ofNRS 240.010are not public information and are confidential. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided in subsections 4 and 5 and inNRS 239.0115, information and documents obtained by or filed with the Secretary of State in connection with an investigation concerning a possible violation of the provisions ofNRS 240.001to240.206, inclusive, are not public information and are confidential. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Secretary of State may submit any information or evidence obtained in connection with an investigation concerning a possible violation of the provisions ofNRS 240.001to240.206, inclusive, to the appropriate district attorney for the purpose of prosecuting a criminal action. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Secretary of State may disclose any information or documents obtained in connection with an investigation concerning a possible violation of the provisions ofNRS 240.001to240.206, inclusive, to an agency of this State or a political subdivision of this State.

section.heading: Appointment by Secretary of State; cancellation of appointment; unlawful acts; injunctive relief.

content.p: The Secretary of State may appoint notaries public in this State. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Secretary of State shall not appoint as a notary public a person: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Who submits an application containing a substantial and material misstatement or omission of fact. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Whose previous appointment as a notary public in this State or another state has been revoked for cause. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Who, except as otherwise provided in subsection 3, has been convicted of, or entered a plea of guilty, guilty but mentally ill or nolo contendere to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A crime involving moral turpitude; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Burglary, conversion, embezzlement, extortion, forgery, fraud, identity theft, larceny, obtaining money under false pretenses, robbery or any other crime involving misappropriation of the identity or property of another person or entity, ï¿½if the Secretary of State is aware of such a conviction or plea before the Secretary of State makes the appointment. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Against whom a complaint that alleges a violation of a provision of this chapter is pending. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Who has not submitted to the Secretary of State proof satisfactory to the Secretary of State that the person has enrolled in and successfully completed a course of study provided pursuant toNRS 240.018. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A person who has been convicted of, or entered a plea of guilty, guilty but mentally ill or nolo contendere to, a crime involving moral turpitude may apply for appointment as a notary public if the person provides proof satisfactory to the Secretary of State that: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

More than 10 years have elapsed since the date of the personï¿½s release from confinement or the expiration of the period of his or her parole, probation or sentence, whichever is later; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The crime for which the person was convicted or entered a plea is not one of the crimes enumerated in subparagraph
of paragraph
of subsection 2. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A notary public may cancel his or her appointment by submitting a written notice to the Secretary of State. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
It is unlawful for a person to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Represent himself or herself as a notary public appointed pursuant to this section if the person has not received a certificate of appointment from the Secretary of State pursuant to this chapter, or if his or her appointment is expired, revoked or suspended or is otherwise not in good standing. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Submit an application for appointment as a notary public that contains a substantial and material misstatement or omission of fact. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Violate any provision of this chapter, including, without limitation, the provisions ofNRS 240.085. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any person who violates a provision of paragraph
of subsection 5 is liable for a civil penalty of not more than $2,000 for each violation, plus reasonable attorneyï¿½s fees and costs. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any person who is aware of a violation of this chapter by a notary public or a person applying for appointment as a notary public may file a complaint with the Secretary of State setting forth the details of the violation that are known by the person who is filing the complaint. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Secretary of State may request that the Attorney General bring an action to enjoin any violation of paragraph
of subsection 5 and recover any penalties, attorneyï¿½s fees and costs.

section.heading: General qualifications; conditions for appointment of resident of adjoining state.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in this section, a person appointed as a notary public must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be a resident of this State. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be at least 18 years of age. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Possess his or her civil rights. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Have completed a course of study pursuant toNRS 240.018. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Secretary of State may appoint a person who resides in an adjoining state as a notary public if the person: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Maintains a place of business in the State of Nevada that is registered pursuant tochapter 76of NRS and any applicable business licensing requirements of the local government where the business is located; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Is regularly employed at an office, business or facility located within the State of Nevada by an employer registered to do business in this State. ï¿½If such a person ceases to maintain a place of business in this State or regular employment at an office, business or facility located within this State, the Secretary of State may suspend the personï¿½s appointment. The Secretary of State may reinstate an appointment suspended pursuant to this subsection if the notary public submits to the Secretary of State, before his or her term of appointment as a notary public expires, the information required pursuant to subsection 2 ofNRS 240.030.

section.heading: Prohibition on collecting social security numbers or alternative personally identifying number from notary public or applicant for appointment as notary public.

content.p: The Secretary of State shall not collect the social security number or an alternative personally identifying number, including, without limitation, an individual taxpayer identification number, from a notary public or an applicant for appointment as a notary public.

section.heading: Regulations of Secretary of State.

content.p: May adopt regulations: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Prescribing the procedure for the appointment and mandatory training of a notary public. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Establishing procedures for the notarization of digital or electronic signatures. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Shall adopt regulations prescribing the form of each affidavit required pursuant to subsection 2 ofNRS 240.030.
The Secretary of State may: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Provide courses of study for the mandatory training of notaries public. Such courses of study: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Must include at least 3 hours of instruction and an examination relating to the functions and duties of notaries public; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
May be conducted in person or online by the Secretary of State or a vendor approved by the Secretary of State. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Charge a reasonable fee to each person who enrolls in a course of study for the mandatory training of notaries public. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A course of study provided pursuant to this section must comply with the regulations adopted pursuant to subsection 1 ofNRS 240.017. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The following persons are required to enroll in and successfully complete a course of study provided pursuant to this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A person applying for appointment as a notary public for the first time. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A person renewing his or her appointment as a notary public. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A person who has committed a violation of this chapter or whose appointment as a notary public has been suspended, and who has been required by the Secretary of State to enroll in a course of study provided pursuant to this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Secretary of State shall deposit the fees collected pursuant to paragraph

of subsection 1 in the Notary Public Training Account which is hereby created in the State General Fund. The Account must be administered by the Secretary of State. Any interest and income earned on the money in the Account, after deducting any applicable charges, must be credited to the Account. Any money remaining in the Account at the end of a fiscal year does not revert to the State General Fund, and the balance in the Account must be carried forward. All claims against the Account must be paid as other claims against the State are paid. The money in the Account may be expended: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

To pay for expenses related to providing courses of study for the mandatory training of notaries public, including, without limitation, the rental of rooms and other facilities, advertising, travel and the printing and preparation of course materials; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For any other purpose authorized by the Legislature. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
At the end of each fiscal year, the Secretary of State shall reconcile the amount of the fees collected pursuant to paragraph

of subsection 1 and the expenses related to administering the training of notaries public pursuant to this chapter and deposit any excess fees received with the State Treasurer for credit to the State General Fund.

section.heading: Powers limited to areas within this State; term of office.

content.p: A person appointed as a notary public pursuant to this chapter may perform notarial acts in any part of this state for a term of 4 years, unless sooner removed. Such an appointment or registration as an electronic notary public pursuant toNRS 240.192does not authorize the person to perform notarial acts in another state.
Each person applying for appointment as a notary public must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
At the time the applicant submits his or her application, pay to the Secretary of State $35. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Take and subscribe to the oath set forth inSection 2 of Article 15of the Constitution of the State of Nevada as if the applicant were a public officer. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Submit to the Secretary of State proof satisfactory to the Secretary of State that the applicant has enrolled in and successfully completed a course of study provided pursuant toNRS 240.018. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Enter into a bond to the State of Nevada in the sum of $10,000, to be filed with the clerk of the county in which the applicant resides or, if the applicant is a resident of an adjoining state, with the clerk of the county in this State in which the applicant maintains a place of business or is employed. The applicant must submit to the Secretary of State a certificate issued by the appropriate county clerk which indicates that the applicant filed the bond required pursuant to this paragraph. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Submit to the Secretary of State a declaration under penalty of perjury stating that the applicant has not had an appointment as a notary public revoked or suspended in this State or any other state or territory of the United States. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If required by the Secretary of State, submit: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A complete set of the fingerprints of the applicant and written permission authorizing the Secretary of State to forward the fingerprints to the Central Repository for Nevada Records of Criminal History for submission to the Federal Bureau of Investigation for its report; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A fee established by regulation of the Secretary of State which must not exceed the sum of the amounts charged by the Central Repository for Nevada Records of Criminal History and the Federal Bureau of Investigation for processing the fingerprints. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

In addition to the requirements set forth in subsection 1, an applicant for appointment as a notary public who resides in an adjoining state must submit to the Secretary of State with the application: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An affidavit setting forth the adjoining state in which the applicant resides, the applicantï¿½s mailing address and the address of the applicantï¿½s place of business or employment that is located within the State of Nevada; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A copy of the applicantï¿½s state business license issued pursuant tochapter 76of NRS and any business license required by the local government where the business is located, if the applicant is self-employed; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Unless the applicant is self-employed, a copy of the state business license of the applicantï¿½s employer, a copy of any business license of the applicantï¿½s employer that is required by the local government where the business is located and an affidavit from the applicantï¿½s employer setting forth the facts which show that the employer regularly employs the applicant at an office, business or facility which is located within the State of Nevada. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

In completing an application, bond, oath or other document necessary to apply for appointment as a notary public, an applicant must not be required to disclose his or her residential address or telephone number on any such document which will become available to the public. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The bond, together with the oath, must be filed and recorded in the office of the county clerk of the county in which the applicant resides when the applicant applies for the appointment or, if the applicant is a resident of an adjoining state, with the clerk of the county in this State in which the applicant maintains a place of business or is employed. On a form provided by the Secretary of State, the county clerk shall immediately certify to the Secretary of State that the required bond and oath have been filed and recorded. Upon receipt of the application, fee and certification that the required bond and oath have been filed and recorded, the Secretary of State shall issue a certificate of appointment as a notary public to the applicant. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The term of a notary public commences on the effective date of the bond required pursuant to paragraph
of subsection 1. A notary public shall not perform a notarial act after the effective date of the bond unless the notary public has been issued a certificate of appointment. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, the Secretary of State shall charge a fee of $10 for each duplicate or amended certificate of appointment which is issued to a notary. If the notary public does not receive an original certificate of appointment, the Secretary of State shall provide a duplicate certificate of appointment without charge if the notary public requests such a duplicate within 60 days after the date on which the original certificate was issued.

section.heading: Annual submission of copy of business license by resident of adjoining state.

content.p: A notary public who is a resident of an adjoining state shall submit to the Secretary of State annually, within 30 days before the anniversary date of his or her appointment as a notary public, a copy of the state business license of the place of employment of the notary public in the State of Nevada issued pursuant tochapter 76of NRS, a copy of any license required by the local government where the business is located and the information required pursuant to subsection 2 ofNRS 240.030.

section.heading: Requirements for bond; notification of exhaustion of penal sum; release of surety; suspension of appointment; reinstatement of appointment.

content.p: The bond required to be filed pursuant toNRS 240.030must be executed by the person applying to become a notary public as principal and by a surety company qualified and authorized to do business in this State. The bond must be made payable to the State of Nevada and be conditioned to provide indemnification to a person determined to have suffered damage as a result of an act by the notary public which violates a provision ofNRS 240.001to240.169, inclusive or, if applicable, an act by the electronic notary public which violates a provision ofNRS 240.001to240.206, inclusive. The surety company shall pay a final, nonappealable judgment of a court of this State that has jurisdiction, upon receipt of written notice of final judgment. The bond may be continuous but, regardless of the duration of the bond, the aggregate liability of the surety does not exceed the penal sum of the bond. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the penal sum of the bond is exhausted, the surety company shall notify the Secretary of State in writing within 30 days after its exhaustion. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The surety bond must cover the period of the appointment of the notary public, except when a surety is released. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A surety on a bond filed pursuant toNRS 240.030may be released after the surety gives 30 daysï¿½ written notice to the Secretary of State and notary public, but the release does not discharge or otherwise affect a claim filed by a person for damage resulting from an act of the notary public which is alleged to have occurred while the bond was in effect. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The appointment of a notary public is suspended by operation of law when the notary public is no longer covered by a surety bond as required by this section andNRS 240.030or the penal sum of the bond is exhausted. If the Secretary of State receives notice pursuant to subsection 4 that the bond will be released or pursuant to subsection 2 that the penal sum of the bond is exhausted, the Secretary of State shall immediately notify the notary public in writing that his or her appointment will be suspended by operation of law until another surety bond is filed in the same manner and amount as the bond being terminated. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Secretary of State may reinstate the appointment of a notary public whose appointment has been suspended pursuant to subsection 5, if the notary public, before his or her current term of appointment expires: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Submits to the Secretary of State: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An application for an amended certificate of appointment as a notary public; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A certificate issued by the clerk of the county in which the applicant resides or, if the applicant is a resident of an adjoining state, the county in this State in which the applicant maintains a place of business or is employed, which indicates that the applicant filed a new surety bond with the clerk. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Pays to the Secretary of State a fee of $10.

section.heading: Amended certificate of appointment: Required for certain changes in information; suspension for failure to obtain; fee; issuance.

content.p: If, at any time during his or her appointment, a notary public changes his or her mailing address, county of residence or signature or, if the notary public is a resident of an adjoining state, changes his or her place of business or employment, the notary public shall submit to the Secretary of State a request for an amended certificate of appointment on a form provided by the Secretary of State. The request must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Include the new information; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be submitted within 30 days after making that change; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be accompanied by a fee of $10. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Secretary of State may suspend the appointment of a notary public who fails to provide to the Secretary of State notice of a change in any of the information specified in subsection 1. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If a notary public changes his or her name during his or her appointment and the notary public intends to use his or her new name in the performance of notarial duties, the notary public shall submit to the Secretary of State a request for an amended certificate of appointment on a form provided by the Secretary of State. The request must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be submitted within 30 days after making the change; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be accompanied by a fee of $10. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Upon receipt of a request for an amended certificate of appointment and the appropriate fee, the Secretary of State shall issue an amended certificate of appointment. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
When the notary public receives the amended certificate of appointment, the notary public shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Destroy his or her notaryï¿½s stamp and obtain a new notaryï¿½s stamp which includes the information on the amended certificate. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Notify the surety company which issued his or her bond of the changes.

section.heading: Use of stamp; embossed notarial seal not required; requirements of stamp; storage of stamp.

content.p: The statement required by paragraph
of subsection 1 ofNRS 240.1655must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be imprinted in indelible, photographically reproducible ink with a rubber or other mechanical stamp; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Set forth: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The name of the notary public; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the notary public so desires, the Great Seal of the State of Nevada; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the notary public is a resident of an adjoining state, the word ï¿½nonresident.ï¿½ ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
After July 1, 1965, an embossed notarial seal is not required on notarized documents. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The stamp required pursuant to subsection 1 must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be a rectangle, not larger than 1 inch by 2 1/2 inches, and may contain a border design; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Produce a legible imprint. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A notary public shall not affix his or her stamp over printed material. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A notary public shall keep his or her stamp in a secure location during any period in which the notary public is not using the stamp to perform a notarial act. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section, ï¿½mechanical stampï¿½ includes an imprint made by a computer or other similar technology.

section.heading: Replacement of lost or inoperable stamp; prerequisite to production of stamp.

content.p: If the stamp of a notary public is lost, the notary public shall, within 10 days after the stamp is lost, submit to the Secretary of State a request for an amended certificate of appointment, on a form provided by the Secretary of State, and obtain a new stamp in accordance withNRS 240.036. The request must be accompanied by a fee of $10. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the stamp is destroyed, broken, damaged or otherwise rendered inoperable, the notary public shall immediately notify the Secretary of State of that fact and obtain a new stamp. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A person or governmental entity shall not make, manufacture or otherwise produce a notaryï¿½s stamp unless the notary public presents his or her original or amended certificate of appointment or a certified copy of his or her original or amended certificate of appointment to that person or governmental entity.

section.heading: Actions required upon resignation or death of notary public.

content.p: If a notary public resigns or dies during his or her appointment, the notary public, or the executor of the estate of the notary public, as appropriate, shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Notify the Secretary of State of the resignation or death; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Destroy the notaryï¿½s stamp. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Upon the receipt of the notice required by subsection 1, the Secretary of State shall cancel the appointment of the notary public, effective on the date on which the notice was received.

section.heading: Powers of notary public.

content.p: A notary public may, during normal business hours, perform notarial acts in lawful transactions for a person who requests the act and tenders the appropriate fee.

section.heading: Performance of authorized notarial acts; restricted notarial acts.

content.p: A notarial officer may perform a notarial act authorized byNRS 240.001to240.169, inclusive, or by law of this State other thanNRS 240.001to240.169, inclusive. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A notarial officer other than a notary public may not perform a notarial act with respect to a document to which the officer or the officerï¿½s spouse or domestic partner is a party, or in which either of them has a direct beneficial interest. A notary public may not perform a notarial act if the notarial act is prohibited byNRS 240.001to240.169, inclusive. A notarial act performed in violation of this subsection is voidable.

section.heading: Personal knowledge of identity.

content.p: For the purposes ofNRS 240.001to240.169, inclusive, a notarial officer has personal knowledge of the identity of a person appearing before the officer if the person is personally known to the officer through dealings sufficient to provide reasonable certainty that the person has the identity claimed.

section.heading: Evidentiary effect of signature; limitations on evidentiary effect of certification of documents.

content.p: The signature of a notary public on a document shall be deemed to be evidence only that the notary public knows the contents of the document that constitute the signature, execution, acknowledgment, oath, affirmation or affidavit. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

When a notary public certifies that a document is a certified or true copy of an original document, the certification shall not be deemed to be evidence that the notary public knows the contents of the document.

section.heading: Restrictions on powers of notary public; exceptions.

content.p: A notary public may not perform a notarial act if: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided in subsections 2 and 3, the notary public has or will receive directly from a transaction relating to the instrument or pleading a commission, fee, advantage, right, title, interest, property or other consideration in excess of the fee authorized pursuant toNRS 240.100for the notarial act; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The notary public and the person whose signature is to be acknowledged, sworn to or witnessed or attested are domestic partners; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The person whose signature is to be acknowledged, sworn to or witnessed or attested is a relative of the domestic partner of the notary public or a relative of the notary public by marriage or consanguinity. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A notary public who is an attorney licensed to practice law in this State may perform a notarial act on an instrument or pleading if the notary public has or will receive directly from a transaction relating to the instrument or pleading a fee for providing legal services in excess of the fee authorized pursuant toNRS 240.100for the notarial act. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A notary public who is registered to engage in the business of a document preparation service may perform a notarial act on a document if the notary public has received or will receive directly from a transaction relating to the document a fee for providing document preparation services in addition to the fee authorized pursuant toNRS 240.100for the notarial act. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section, ï¿½relativeï¿½ includes, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A grandparent, parent, brother, sister, half brother, half sister, stepbrother or stepsister of the spouse or domestic partner of the notary public; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A natural born child, stepchild or adopted child of a sibling or half sibling of the notary public or of a sibling or half sibling of the spouse or domestic partner of the notary public.

section.heading: Prohibited acts.

content.p: Influence a person to enter or not enter into a lawful transaction involving a notarial act performed by the notary public. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Certify an instrument containing a statement known by the notary public to be false. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Perform any act as a notary public with intent to deceive or defraud, including, without limitation, altering the journal that the notary public is required to keep pursuant toNRS 240.120. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Endorse or promote any product, service or offering if his or her appointment as a notary public is used in the endorsement or promotional statement. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Certify photocopies of a certificate of birth, death or marriage or a divorce decree. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Allow any other person to use his or her notaryï¿½s stamp. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Allow any other person to sign the notaryï¿½s name in a notarial capacity. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Perform a notarial act on a document that contains only a signature. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Perform a notarial act on a document, including a form that requires the signer to provide information within blank spaces, unless the document has been filled out completely and has been signed. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Make or note a protest of a negotiable instrument unless the notary public is employed by a depository institution and the protest is made or noted within the scope of that employment. As used in this subsection, ï¿½depository institutionï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 657.037. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Affix his or her stamp to any document which does not contain a notarial certificate.

section.heading: Advertisements in language other than English to contain notice if notary public is not an attorney; use of certain non-English terms in advertisements prohibited; penalties.

content.p: Every notary public who is not an attorney licensed to practice law in this State and who advertises his or her services as a notary public in a language other than English by any form of communication, except a single plaque on his or her desk, shall post or otherwise include with the advertisement a notice in the language in which the advertisement appears. The notice must be of a conspicuous size, if in writing, and must appear in substantially the following form: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ I AM NOT AN ATTORNEY IN THE STATE OF NEVADA. I AM NOT LICENSED TO GIVE LEGAL ADVICE. I MAY NOT ACCEPT FEES FOR GIVING LEGAL ADVICE. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A notary public who is not an attorney licensed to practice law in this State shall not use the term ï¿½notario,ï¿½ ï¿½notario publico,ï¿½ ï¿½licenciadoï¿½ or any other equivalent non-English term in any form of communication that advertises his or her services as a notary public, including, without limitation, a business card, stationery, notice and sign. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the Secretary of State finds a notary public guilty of violating the provisions of subsection 1 or 2, the Secretary of State shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Suspend the appointment of the notary public for not less than 1 year. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Revoke the appointment of the notary public for a third or subsequent offense. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Assess a civil penalty of not more than $2,000 for each violation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Unless a greater penalty is provided pursuant toNRS 240.175, a notary public who is found guilty in a criminal prosecution of violating subsection 1 or 2 shall be punished by a fine of not more than $2,000. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An employer of a notary public shall not: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Prohibit the notary public from meeting the requirements set forth in subsection 1; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Advertise using the term ï¿½notario,ï¿½ ï¿½notario publico,ï¿½ ï¿½licenciadoï¿½ or any other equivalent non-English term in any form of communication that advertises notary public services, including, without limitation, a business card, stationery, notice and sign, unless the notary public under his or her employment is an attorney licensed to practice law in this State. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the Secretary of State finds the employer of a notary public guilty of violating a provision of subsection 5, the Secretary of State shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Notify the employer in writing of the violation and order the immediate removal of such language. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Assess a civil penalty of not more than $2,000 for each violation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Unless a greater penalty is provided pursuant toNRS 240.175, the employer of a notary public who is found guilty in a criminal prosecution of violating a provision of subsection 5 shall be punished by a fine of not more than $2,000.

section.heading: Fees for services; additional fees for travel expenses; notarial acts performed within and outside scope of employment.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in subsection 3, a notary public may charge the following fees and no more: For taking an acknowledgment, for the first signature of each signer..... $15.00 For each additional signature of each signer.................................................... 7.50 For administering an oath or affirmation.......................................................... 7.50 For a certified copy............................................................................................... 7.50 For a jurat, for each signature on the affidavit............................................... 15.00 For performing a marriage ceremony.............................................................. 75.00 ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
All fees prescribed in this section are payable in advance, if demanded. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A notary public may charge an additional fee for traveling to perform a notarial act if: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The notary public explains to the person requesting the notarial act that the fee is in addition to the fee authorized in subsection 1 and is not required by law; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The person requesting the notarial act agrees in advance upon the hourly rate that the notary public will charge for the additional fee; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The additional fee does not exceed: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the person requesting the notarial act asks the notary public to travel between the hours of 6 a.m. and 7 p.m., $15 per hour. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the person requesting the notarial act asks the notary public to travel between the hours of 7 p.m. and 6 a.m., $30 per hour. ï¿½The notary public may charge a minimum of 2 hours for such travel and shall charge on a pro rata basis after the first 2 hours. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A notary public is entitled to charge the amount of the additional fee agreed to in advance by the person requesting the notarial act pursuant to subsection 3 if: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The person requesting the notarial act cancels the request after the notary public begins his or her travel to perform the requested notarial act. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The notary public is unable to perform the requested notarial act as a result of the actions of the person who requested the notarial act or any other person who is necessary for the performance of the notarial act. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

For each additional fee that a notary public charges for traveling to perform a notarial act pursuant to subsection 3, the notary public shall enter in the journal that he or she keeps pursuant toNRS 240.120: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The amount of the fee; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The date and time that the notary public began and ended such travel. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A person who employs a notary public may prohibit the notary public from charging a fee for a notarial act that the notary public performs within the scope of the employment. Such a person shall not require the notary public whom the person employs to surrender to the person all or part of a fee charged by the notary public for a notarial act performed outside the scope of the employment of the notary public.

section.heading: Posting of table of fees.

content.p: If a notary public charges fees for performing notarial acts, the notary public shall publish and set up in some conspicuous place in his or her office a table of those fees, according to this chapter, for the inspection of all persons who have business in his or her office. The schedule must not be printed in smaller than 1/2-inch type. A notary public shall not charge fees unless the notary public has published and set up a table of fees in accordance with this subsection.

Except as otherwise provided in subsection 2, each notary public shall keep a journal in his or her office in which the notary public shall enter for each notarial act performed, at the time the act is performed: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The fees charged, if any; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The title of the document; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Subject to the provisions of subsection 4, a description of the evidence used by the notary public to verify the identification of the person whose signature is being notarized; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An indication of whether the notary public administered an oath; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The type of certificate used to evidence the notarial act, as required pursuant toNRS 240.1655. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A notary public may make one entry in the journal which documents more than one notarial act if the notarial acts documented are performed: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For the same person and at the same time; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
On one document or on similar documents. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
When performing a notarial act for a person, a notary public need not require the person to sign the journal if: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The notary public has personal knowledge of the identity of the person; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The person is an employer or coworker of the notary public and the notarial act relates to a transaction performed in the ordinary course of the personï¿½s business. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If, pursuant to subsection 3, a notary public does not require a person to sign the journal, the notary public shall enter ï¿½known personallyï¿½ as the description required to be entered into the journal pursuant to paragraph
of subsection 1. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the notary verifies the identification of the person whose signature is being notarized on the basis of a credible witness, the notary public shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Require the witness to sign the journal in the space provided for the description of the evidence used; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Make a notation in the journal that the witness is a credible witness. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The journal must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be open to public inspection. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be in a bound volume with preprinted page numbers. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A notary public shall, upon request and payment of the fee set forth inNRS 240.100, provide a certified copy of an entry in his or her journal. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A notary public shall keep his or her journal in a secure location during any period in which the notary public is not making an entry or notation in the journal pursuant to this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A notary public shall retain each journal that the notary public has kept pursuant to this section until 7 years after the date on which he or she ceases to be a notary public. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A notary public shall file a report with the Secretary of State and the appropriate law enforcement agency if the journal of the notary public is lost or stolen. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions of this section do not apply to a person who is authorized to perform a notarial act pursuant to paragraph
or
of subsection 1 ofNRS 240.1635.

section.heading: Only authorized fees to be charged.

content.p: A notary public shall not charge a fee to perform a service unless the notary public is authorized to charge a fee for such a service pursuant to this chapter.

section.heading: Unlawful possession of certain personal property of notary public.

content.p: The following items are the personal property of a notary public: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
His or her official stamp; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
His or her journal; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
His or her certificate of appointment. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

It is unlawful for a person who comes into possession of the official stamp, journal or certificate of appointment of a notary public to withhold such an item from the notary public, whether or not the person provided the notary public with the money to acquire the item.

section.heading: Unlawful reproduction or use of completed notarial certificate; penalty.

content.p: It is unlawful for any person to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Photocopy or otherwise reproduce a completed notarial certificate with a notaryï¿½s statement and signature if that certificate is reproduced for use in a mailing to endorse, promote or sell any product, service or offering; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Include a photocopy or other reproduction of a completed notarial certificate with a notaryï¿½s statement and signature in a mailing to endorse, promote or sell any product, service or offering. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Unless a greater penalty is provided pursuant toNRS 240.175, any person who violates any of the provisions of subsection 1 is guilty of a gross misdemeanor.

section.heading: Unlawful destruction, defacement or concealment of notarial record.

content.p: It is unlawful for a person to knowingly destroy, deface or conceal a notarial record.

For misconduct or neglect in a case in which a notary public appointed pursuant to the authority of this State may act, either by the law of this State or of another state, territory or country, or by the law of nations, or by commercial usage, the notary public is liable on his or her official bond to the parties injured thereby, for all the damages sustained. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The employer of a notary public may be assessed a civil penalty by the Secretary of State of not more than $2,000 for each violation specified in subsection 4 committed by the notary public, and the employer is liable for any damages proximately caused by the misconduct of the notary public, if: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The notary public was acting within the scope of his or her employment at the time the notary public engaged in the misconduct; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The employer of the notary public consented to the misconduct of the notary public. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Secretary of State may refuse to appoint or may suspend or revoke the appointment of a notary public who fails to provide to the Secretary of State, within a reasonable time, information that the Secretary of State requests from the notary public in connection with a complaint which alleges a violation of this chapter. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, for any willful violation or neglect of duty or other violation of this chapter, or upon proof that a notary public has been convicted of, or entered a plea of guilty, guilty but mentally ill or nolo contendere to, a crime described in paragraph
of subsection 2 ofNRS 240.010: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The appointment of the notary public may be suspended for a period determined by the Secretary of State, but not exceeding the time remaining on the appointment; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The appointment of the notary public may be revoked after a hearing; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The notary public may be assessed a civil penalty of not more than $2,000 for each violation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the Secretary of State revokes or suspends the appointment of a notary public pursuant to this section, the Secretary of State shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Cause notice of the revocation or suspension to be published on the website of the Secretary of State; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If a county clerk has issued a certificate of permission to perform marriages to the notary public pursuant toNRS 122.064, notify the county clerk of the revocation or suspension. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided by law, the Secretary of State may assess the civil penalty that is authorized pursuant to this section upon a notary public whose appointment has expired if the notary public committed the violation that justifies the civil penalty before his or her appointment expired. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The appointment of a notary public may be suspended or revoked by the Secretary of State pending a hearing if the Secretary of State believes it is in the public interest or is necessary to protect the public.

section.heading: Notarization of signature of person not in presence of notary public unlawful; penalty.

content.p: A notary public who is appointed pursuant to this chapter shall not willfully notarize the signature of a person unless the person is in the presence of the notary public and: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is known to the notary public; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If unknown to the notary public, provides a credible witness or documentary evidence of identification to the notary public. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Unless a greater penalty is provided pursuant toNRS 240.175, a person who: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Violates the provisions of subsection 1; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Aids and abets a notary public to commit a violation of subsection 1, ï¿½is guilty of a gross misdemeanor.

section.heading: Short title; uniformity of application and construction.

content.p: These sections must be applied and construed to effectuate their general purpose to make uniform the law with respect to the subject of these sections among states enacting them.

section.heading: Notarial acts in this State.

content.p: A notarial act may be performed within this State by the following persons: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A notary public of this State; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A justice of the peace; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any other person authorized to perform the specific act by the law of this State; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A person authorized to perform the specific act by the law of a federally recognized Indian tribe or nation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Notarial acts performed within this State under federal authority as provided inNRS 240.1645have the same effect as if performed by a notarial officer of this State. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The signature and title of a person performing a notarial act are prima facie evidence that the signature is genuine and that the person holds the designated title.

section.heading: Notarial acts in other jurisdictions of United States.

content.p: A notarial act has the same effect under the law of this State as if performed by a notarial officer of this State, if performed in another state, commonwealth, territory, district or possession of the United States by any of the following persons: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A notary public of that jurisdiction; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A judge, clerk or deputy clerk of a court of that jurisdiction; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any other person authorized by the law of that jurisdiction to perform notarial acts. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Notarial acts performed in other jurisdictions of the United States under federal authority as provided inNRS 240.1645have the same effect as if performed by a notarial officer of this State. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The signature and title of a person performing a notarial act are prima facie evidence that the signature is genuine and that the person holds the designated title. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The signature and indicated title of an officer listed in paragraph
or
of subsection 1 conclusively establish the authority of a holder of that title to perform a notarial act.

section.heading: Notarial acts under federal authority.

content.p: A notarial act has the same effect under the law of this State as if performed by a notarial officer of this State if performed anywhere by any of the following persons under authority granted by the law of the United States: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A judge, clerk or deputy clerk of a court; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An officer of the foreign service or consular officer of the United States; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any other person authorized by federal law to perform notarial acts. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The signature and title of a person performing a notarial act are prima facie evidence that the signature is genuine and that the person holds the designated title. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The signature and indicated title of an officer listed in paragraph
or
of subsection 1 conclusively establish the authority of a holder of that title to perform a notarial act.

section.heading: Foreign notarial acts.

content.p: A notarial act has the same effect under the law of this State as if performed by a notarial officer of this State if performed within the jurisdiction of and under authority of a foreign nation or its constituent units or a multinational or international organization by the following persons: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A notary public; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A person authorized by federal law to perform notarial acts; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A person authorized by the law of a federally recognized Indian tribe or nation to perform notarial acts. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A certificate by an officer of the foreign service or consular officer of the United States stationed in the nation under the jurisdiction of which the notarial act was performed, or a certificate by an officer of the foreign service or consular officer of that nation stationed in the United States, conclusively establishes a matter relating to the authenticity or validity of the notarial act set forth in the certificate. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An official stamp or seal of the person performing the notarial act is prima facie evidence that the signature is genuine and that the person holds the indicated title. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An official stamp or seal of an officer listed in paragraph
or
of subsection 1 is prima facie evidence that a person with the indicated title has authority to perform notarial acts. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the title of office and indication of authority to perform notarial acts appears either in a digest of foreign law or in a list customarily used as a source for that information, the authority of an officer with that title to perform notarial acts is conclusively established.

section.heading: Notarial acts.

content.p: A notarial act must be evidenced by a certificate that: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Identifies the county, including, without limitation, Carson City, in this State in which the notarial act was performed in substantially the following form: State of Nevada County of ............................... ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph, includes the name of the person whose signature is being notarized. If the certificate is for certifying a copy of a document, the certificate must include the name of the person presenting the document. If the certificate is for the jurat of a subscribing witness, the certificate must include the name of the subscribing witness. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Is signed and dated in ink by the notarial officer performing the notarial act. If the notarial officer is a notary public, the certificate must be signed in the same manner as the signature of the notarial officer that is on file with the Secretary of State. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the notarial officer performing the notarial act is a notary public, includes the statement imprinted with the stamp of the notary public, as described inNRS 240.040. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the notarial officer performing the notarial act is not a notary public, includes the title of the office of the notarial officer and may include the official stamp or seal of that office. If the officer is a commissioned officer on active duty in the military service of the United States, the certificate must also include the officerï¿½s rank. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Except as otherwise provided in subsection 8, a notarial officer shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

In taking an acknowledgment, determine, from personal knowledge or satisfactory evidence, that the person making the acknowledgment is the person whose signature is on the document. The person who signed the document shall present the document to the notarial officer in person. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
In administering an oath or affirmation, determine, from personal knowledge or satisfactory evidence, the identity of the person taking the oath or affirmation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
In certifying a copy of a document, photocopy the entire document and certify that the photocopy is a true and correct copy of the document that was presented to the notarial officer. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
In making or noting a protest of a negotiable instrument, verify compliance with the provisions of subsection 2 ofNRS 104.3505. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

In executing a jurat, administer an oath or affirmation to the affiant and determine, from personal knowledge or satisfactory evidence, that the affiant is the person named in the document. The affiant shall sign the document in the presence of the notarial officer. The notarial officer shall administer the oath or affirmation required pursuant to this paragraph in substantially the following form: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Do you (solemnly swear, or affirm) that the statements in this document are true, (so help you God)? ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A certificate of a notarial act is sufficient if it meets the requirements of subsections 1 and 2 and it: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is in the short form set forth inNRS 240.166to240.169, inclusive; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is in a form prescribed by the laws or regulations applicable in the place in which the notarial act was performed; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Sets forth the actions of the notarial officer and those are sufficient to meet the requirements of the designated notarial act. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For the purposes of paragraphs
and
of subsection 2, a notarial officer has satisfactory evidence that a person is the person whose signature is on a document if the person: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is personally known to the notarial officer; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is identified upon an oath or affirmation of a subscribing witness who is personally known to the notarial officer; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
In the case of a person who is 65 years of age or older and cannot satisfy the requirements of paragraphs
to
, inclusive, is identified upon the basis of an identification card issued by a governmental agency or a senior citizen center. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An oath or affirmation administered pursuant to paragraph

of subsection 4 must be in substantially the following form: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Do you (solemnly swear, or affirm) that you personally know ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½(name of person who signed the document)ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½, (so help you God)? ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A notarial officer shall not affix his or her signature over printed material. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
By executing a certificate of a notarial act, the notarial officer certifies that the notarial officer has complied with all the requirements of this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

section.heading: Short title.

content.p: NRS 240.181to240.206, inclusive, may be cited as the Electronic Notarization Enabling Act.

section.heading: Definitions.

content.p: As used inNRS 240.181to240.206, inclusive, unless the context otherwise requires, the words and terms defined inNRS 240.1821to240.1882, inclusive, have the meanings ascribed to them in those sections.

section.heading: ï¿½Audio-video communicationï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Audio-video communicationï¿½ means communication by which a person is able to see, hear and communicate with another person in real time using electronic means.

section.heading: ï¿½Credentialï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Credentialï¿½ means a tangible record evidencing the identity of a person.

section.heading: ï¿½Dynamic knowledge-based authentication assessmentï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Dynamic knowledge-based authentication assessmentï¿½ means an identity assessment that is based on a set of questions formulated from public or private data sources for which the person taking the assessment has not previously provided an answer and that meets any rules or regulations adopted by the Secretary of State.

section.heading: ï¿½Electronicï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Electronicï¿½ means of or relating to technology having electrical, digital, magnetic, wireless, optical, electromagnetic or similar capabilities.

section.heading: ï¿½Electronic documentï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Electronic documentï¿½ means a document that is created, generated, sent, communicated, received or stored by electronic means.

section.heading: ï¿½Electronic notarial actï¿½ defined.

content.p: Taking an acknowledgment; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Administering an oath or affirmation; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Executing a jurat; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Certifying a true and correct copy; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Performing such other duties as may be prescribed by a specific statute.

section.heading: ï¿½Electronic notary publicï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Electronic notary publicï¿½ means a person registered with the Secretary of State pursuant toNRS 240.181to240.206, inclusive, to perform electronic notarial acts.

section.heading: ï¿½Electronic sealï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Electronic sealï¿½ means information within a notarized electronic document that includes the name, jurisdiction and expiration date of the registration of an electronic notary public and generally includes the information required to be set forth in a mechanical stamp pursuant toNRS 240.040.

section.heading: ï¿½Electronic signatureï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Electronic signatureï¿½ means an electronic symbol or process attached to or logically associated with an electronic document and executed or adopted by a person with the intent to sign the electronic document.

section.heading: ï¿½In the presence ofï¿½ or ï¿½appear beforeï¿½ defined.

content.p: In the same physical location as another person and close enough to see, hear, communicate with and exchange credentials with that person; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

In a different physical location from another person but able to see, hear and communicate with the person by means of audio-video communication that meets any rules or regulations adopted by the Secretary of State.

section.heading: Applicability.

content.p: An electronic notary public shall comply with those provisions ofNRS 240.001to240.169, inclusive, which are not inconsistent withNRS 240.181to240.206, inclusive. To the extent that the provisions ofNRS 240.001to240.169, inclusive, conflict with the provisions ofNRS 240.181to240.206, inclusive, the provisions ofNRS 240.181to240.206, inclusive, control.

section.heading: Unlawful acts; injunctive relief.

content.p: It is unlawful for a person to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Represent himself or herself as an electronic notary public if the person has not registered with the Secretary of State pursuant toNRS 240.192. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Submit a registration as an electronic notary public that contains a substantial and material misstatement or omission of fact. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Secretary of State may request that the Attorney General bring an action to enjoin any violation of paragraph
of subsection 1.

section.heading: Registration; oath and bond; fee; electronic notary public.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in subsection 5, each person registering as an electronic notary public must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

At the time of registration, be a notarial officer in this State who has complied with the requirements pertaining to taking an oath and filing a bond set forth inNRS 240.030and240.033and have complied with all applicable notarial requirements set forth in this chapter; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Pay to the Secretary of State a registration fee of $50, which is in addition to the application fee required pursuant toNRS 240.030to be a notarial officer in this State; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Submit to the Secretary of State with the registration proof satisfactory to the Secretary of State that the registrant has: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Successfully completed any required course of study on electronic notarization provided pursuant toNRS 240.195; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Complied with the requirements pertaining to taking an oath and filing a bond set forth inNRS 240.030and240.033. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Unless the Secretary of State establishes a different process for submitting a registration as an electronic notary public, the registration as an electronic notary public must be submitted as an electronic document by electronic mail to[email protected]or, if another electronic mail address is designated by the Secretary of State, to such other designated electronic mail address, and must contain, without limitation, the following information: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
All information required to be included in an application for appointment as a notary public pursuant toNRS 240.030. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

section.heading: Period of registration; suspension of registration by operation of law; changes of information.

content.p: The period of registration of an electronic notary public is coterminous with his or her term of appointment as a notary public pursuant toNRS 240.010. Registration as an electronic notary public must be renewed at the same time a person renews his or her appointment as a notary public. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The registration of an electronic notary public is suspended by operation of law when the electronic notary public is no longer appointed as a notary public in this State. content.p: In addition to any courses of study a notary public is required to complete pursuant toNRS 240.018, the Secretary of State may, by rule or regulation, require a notary public who registers with the Secretary of State as an electronic notary public pursuant toNRS 240.192to complete an additional course of study on electronic notarization in accordance with this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
